pros: I have nothing to add here.
cons: This is a great place to work.

review_title: Growth is the name of the game - an excellent employer
pros: You can grow from within very well. And the opportunities scale up very quickly, as long as you're willing to put in the necessary work--they are not given out for free, and this is to be expected. Provide opportunities and funding for furthering your own professional development. Perhaps some of the most interesting work and engagement that you can find in the job market. People are very nice. The current CEO listens to his employees and supports their ambitions and personal lives. And he lives the work-life balance, setting an example for his employees, so the employee doesn't feel bad about maintaining their own balance. In total, The Council is an exceptional place to work. For this reason, you see many long-tenured employees, coupled with other employees who leave for other opportunities and return later in life--a sign of an excellent employer. Both pension and 401k are offered.
cons: Cohesion can be lacking, as everyone is very autonomous. Pay for DC staff makes it difficult to save, due to cost of living in Washington. That said, there is growth that can change that, should the employee stick around.
None really just needed more pay

pros:
Benefits are great at the council

If you are a manager and above there will be room for growth and respect

There are people at the council who genuinely care about the organization
cons:
This organization is not ideal for those looking for an entry level position. Overload of work and not great compensation. 

The office politics and gossipy atmosphere is horrendous

Some colleagues at the council are very abrasive and do not practice proper office etiquette. Do not speak to anyone about personal matters. 

Do not work at the council if you don’t have a background in agriculture. They will be reluctant to educate you and they are clique like.

pros: Caring, fun people who are passionate about supporting American agriculture producers
cons: Work is highly dependent on ability to travel.

pros: My team is very supportive and there is a great work-life balance.
cons: I have heard that people on other teams aren't as happy.
